intro: Epidendrum sigmodiothoneum, commonly known as the Orchid of the Andes, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to South America. It features striking, long-lasting blooms in shades of red, orange, and yellow, often with a contrasting dark throat. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its leaves are typically narrow and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining potting media to prevent root rot.
